prs.title: Draft: Adapting contracts for zksync os v30
prs.truncated_body:
## What ❔

This PR makes L2 contracts compatible with ZKsync OS design.
Basically, it means mostly two things
- No immutables in L2 contracts.
- No constructors in L2 contracts.

Effectively we split many contracts into L1 and L2 versions, where L2 version doesn't have constructor (instead, it has an `initL2` function), and has no immutables.

prs.title: Fix getSnapshotProposerSequence
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Use the correct block number for retrieving the snapshot. This is change is required because the behavior  of `snapshot()` in bor consensus had changed. Before, it was expecting the caller to pass the parent block of the target block, but now it is expecting the target block to be directly passed in.

Tested in a devnode. 

# Changes

- [x] Bugfix (non-breaking change that s

commits.message:
Fix getSnapshotProposerSequence

Use the correct block number for retrieving the snapshot.
This is change is required because the behavior  of `snapshot()` in bor consensus had changed. Before, it was expecting the caller to pass the parent block of the target block, but now it is expecting the target block to be directly passed in.

commits.message:
dump: output wallclock timestamps in realtime mode

This is not perfect, as some tiles do not populate tspub at all, or use
some other value than fd_tickcount(). Additionally, if the original
tspub was taken more than ~2s away from when the dump tool reads it, the
timestamp decompression will return an incorrect result. Regardless,
this should be more useful than putting the mcache seq in the timestamp
field and yields the expected result for the vast majority of frags.

prs.title: Add `GetTxPriorityHint` and mempool backpressure via priority drops
prs.truncated_body:
Extends the ABCI interface with a side-effect free `GetTxPriorityHint` method and connects transaction priority hints to the mempool. The change gives the network a straightforward way to apply backpressure when the mempool is congested, without blocking liveness-critical transactions. By making the dropping logic priority-aware, nodes can favor important traffic under load.

Three new configura

commits.message:
Add `GetTxPriority` to ABCI interface

Expand the ABCI interface to expose a side-effect free get transaction
priority

Integrate priority hint with mempool

Rename the priority interfaces to hint, to make it clear that it is a
hint.

Integrate it with mempool to reject transactions below threshold when
mempool is over utilised.
Fix typo in proto oneof values
Enhance checktx metrics in relation to priority
Fix metrics label error by adding struct tags
Add logging for priority hint error

Merge branch 'main' into masih/abci-get-tx-priority

# Conflicts:
#	abci/types/types.pb.go
#	proto/tendermint/abci/types.proto

Implement reservoir based priority cutoff determination

Keep a sample of transaction priorities handled by mempool to determine
the drop cut off when mempool is over-utilised.
Do not determine hint if DropUtilisationThreshold is zero

Cache the last asked for percentile for 5 seconds

Cache the last asked for percentile for at least 5 seconds and avoid
redundant re-computation of it if the sample set has not changed. This
cache design is based on the rationale that the percentile value asked
for in Sei is fixed in configuration for the lifetime of the
application. Therefore, the only value that's updated in reservoir is
the samples.

Move reservoir percentile into constructor as a fixed value

To remove a couple of edge cases and performance footgun make the
reservoir less generic into a fixed percentile.

Tighten conditions under which reservoir cache is considered to be dirty

Only consider the percentile cache dirty if add results in expansion of
samples, or it replaces an item with a different value.
Fix failing eviction test by disabling hint based tx drop

commits.message:
fix: Add size limit to WebAuthN data to prevent DoS attacks

- Add MaxWebAuthDataSize constant (64KB) to prevent oversized payloads
- Add ErrWebAuthDataTooLarge error type for size validation failures
- Implement size validation in WebAuthNVerifyRegister and WebAuthNVerifyAuthenticate endpoints
- Add comprehensive tests for size limit validation
- Mitigates DoS vulnerability where attackers could send large CBOR payloads causing linear CPU/memory usage

fix: prevent gas charging before GetAllowance in MultiAnyAllowance

Fixes vulnerability where gas was charged before calling GetAllowance(),
allowing attackers to force validators to consume excessive gas for
minimal fees by crafting transactions with many failing allowances.

Changes:
- Move gas consumption to after successful GetAllowance() calls
- Add comprehensive tests demonstrating vulnerability and fix
- Preserve existing functionality for legitimate use cases

Security Impact:
- Eliminates DoS vector via economic gas/fee mismatch
- Ensures fair gas accounting for failed operations
- Prevents validators from working beyond intended parameters

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

Add comprehensive direct transaction test for MsgSetPlatformMinimum

This test addresses security report #52897 by verifying that MsgSetPlatformMinimum
can be submitted as a direct CLI transaction and properly processed by the network.

The test includes three comprehensive scenarios:
1. DirectCLITransaction: Validates message creation, serialization, and sdk.Msg interface
2. TransactionPipelineIntegration: Tests full transaction pipeline via governance
3. MessageBroadcastingAndProcessing: Verifies network compatibility and processing

This ensures the message works correctly in production transaction flows,
confirming the vulnerability has been resolved.

prs.title: feat(sapience-docs): Integrate Storybook iframe into sapience-docs
prs.truncated_body: Add Storybook integration to sapience-docs. Storybook is built and served directly from the sapience-docs website. Users can navigate to the `/storybook` page by clicking at `Sidebar > Builders guide > UI components`.

prs.title: log: Bitcoin `Buf32` types reverse hex
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

Some 32-byte bitcoin things are represented as `Buf32`.
That creates an issue when we log them because block explorers reverse the bytes as little-endian for things like TXID, WTXID and block hashes.

This PR fixes that by adding custom `Debug`/`Display` impls that reverse these bytes for these bitcoin tuple struct wrappers around `Buf32`.

commits.message: log(btcio): reverse bytes in txid that is consistent with block explorer
